nl.vu.pp.sequential
Class Job

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--nl.vu.pp.sequential.Job
public class Job
extends java.lang.Object

The Job class implements the Iterative Deepening A-Star (IDA*) algorithm [Korf, 1985] to solve the 15-puzzle. After an initial Job instance has been created with a given, shuffled board, the board's goal and a maximum depth (bound), the solve() method will search the game tree up to and including the given bound and return. Everytime a solution is found, the implementation will invoke FifteenPuzzle.addSolution().

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 28.dec.2002

Constructor Detail

Job

public Job(int[][] board,
           int[][] solution,
           int bound)
Used to create the initial (root) job from which the IDA* algorithm is run and the game tree is unfolded.
Invoke solve() to start the algorithm.

Parameters:
board - the shuffled board that needs to be solved.
solution - the board's goal layout.
bound - the maximum depth for the IDA* algorithm.
Method Detail

getDepth

public int getDepth()
Returns the depth in the game tree of this job. The "root job" will always return 0 (zero).

Returns:
the depth in the game tree of this job.

getBound

public int getBound()
Returns the algorithm's bound. The bound determines how deep the program will descent into the game tree before pruning its path. It is a property of many depth-first algorithms.

Returns:
the algorithm's bound.

solve

public void solve()
Invoke this method to solve the job.
It will create and solve up to (bound - depth) new jobs recursively and search for all solutions in its game tree.
